org.hps.readout.rawconverter

Class AbstractMode3RawConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.readout.rawconverter.AbstractBaseRawConverter
      • org.hps.readout.rawconverter.AbstractMode3RawConverter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EcalReadoutMode3RawConverter, HodoscopeReadoutMode3RawConverter

    public abstract class AbstractMode3RawConverter
extends AbstractBaseRawConverter
    AbstractMode3RawConverter provides functionality for the AbstractBaseRawConverter for the handling of Mode-3 hits.

    AbstractMode3RawConverter does not implement any behavior that is specific to a subdetector. That is left for its implementing drivers.
    See Also:
    AbstractBaseRawConverter

    • Field Detail

      • windowSamples

        protected int windowSamples
        Stores the number of samples in the readout window. This is needed to properly account for pulse-clipping in Mode-3 and Mode-7 data, where this value is not retained. This value is not used for Mode-1 input, as the number of samples is known for this data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMode3RawConverter

        public AbstractMode3RawConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • convertHit

        public CalorimeterHit convertHit(RawCalorimeterHit hit,
                                 double timeOffset)
        Converts a Mode-3 digitized hit to a CalorimeterHit object with calibrated energy and time values.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit to convert.
        timeOffset - - The time offset of the hit.
        Returns:
        Returns the converted hit.

      • getTimeShift

        protected abstract double getTimeShift(long channelID)
        Gets the time shift for the specified subdetector channel.
        Parameters:
        cellID - - The detector element ID.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the time shift as a double.

      • setWindowSamples

        public void setWindowSamples(int windowSamples)
        Sets the number of samples in the readout window. Note that this value is ignored for Mode-1 data, since Mode-1 data retains the number of ADC samples already.
        Parameters:
        windowSamples - - The number of 4 ns clock-cycle samples present in the readout window.
